channel.title: Deku NPC Release!

item.title: Deku NPC Release!
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Orngequirrel, post:13, topic:344429”][quote author=man_killerx link=topic=440808.msg3244648#msg3244648 date=1277245631]

first, you have some serious anger problems, go get it checked out, soon

second, if this is true, then if i model 6 cubes together without modifying them and say its link, riding his horse, its correct and it looks just like link? No. Your logic is stupid.

Edit: And by the way, thats the correct deku, from OoT

Nice story, I give a shit why? Just because it does not look like what you seen doesn’t mean its not good. You might want to go to school if you lack that much knowledge.
[/quote]
Seriously, you should give a shit because you’re trying to model a certain thing, which it doesn’t look like, which DOES mean its not good because it doesn’t look like it. And I seem to have the knowledge that you don’t.[/quote]

i hope you realize theres more than 1 version of many things.

Read full topic

item.title: Deku NPC Release!
item.dc:creator: @man_killerx man_killerx
item.description:
@man_killerx wrote:

This was requested (Kinda) It works in my 317, and 507 servers so I would imagine it will work in others. Again 100% made by me, Animated by me. Downloads will only contain minimal virus’s I promise.

The Model Links, Please let me know if it is corrupt/broken.
Uppit -> http://uppit.com/da1rtg486zju/Deku_Files.rar
Megashare -> http://www.MegaShare.com/2229821

1.) Adding the NPC model to your client, Open your class5.java. Add this to it,

if(i == 3000) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; class5.anIntArray94[0] = 5002; class5.aString65 = "Deku"; class5.anInt61 = 50; class5.aByteArray89 = "An Forest Creature.".getBytes(); }

2.) This will be the item that is in your inventory, And head slot. Open up your class8.java in your client files and now add the ints under some that are already there.

if(i == 12000) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anInt174 = 5800; //Inv & Ground class8.anInt181 = 2000; //Zoom class8.anInt190 = 572; class8.anInt198 = 1200; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 16; class8.anInt194 = 1; class8.anInt165 = -1; //Male class8.anInt200 = -1; //Female class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.anInt199 = -1;//noteable class8.aString170 = "Deku Mask"; class8.aByteArray178 = "I wounder what will happen if I use it".getBytes(); }

3.) Okay now, Open your server files and open your client.java and add this in there, Try to search for a old code to put under or something.

if ((playerItems[slot] - 1) == wearID) { if (wearID == 12000) { npcId = 3000; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

4.) Last thing, Now in your server files, Open up Item.java, And if you have it Item4.java. Look for a section called Mask, Helmets, Fullhelm, Whatever and add 12000 at the end of the line, This will make it go into the right slot when worn.

[size=14pt]Compile and enjoy![/size]

Q/A
(Q) Can you teach me to model/animate.
(A) Possibly I do plan on making some youtube videos of this.

(Q) Why am I getting a compile error?
(A) Because you cannot copy and paste.

(Q) What programs did you use to do this?
(A) Metasequoia, DatMaker, And normally I would use RsPoser but this time it was not needed.

(Q) Why am I still a Deku when I take the mask off?
(A) Because I am too lazy to give you that little bit of coding.

Here is a picture, It is kind of small so hard to see.

Read full topic
